1.description: First, create the blade to establish the sharp, defining edge of the object, which will serve as the primary functional component for cutting or slicing tasks. This blade will be positioned prominently at the front, setting the foundation for the subsequent parts that will enhance its usability and overall structure.

2.description: Next, add the guard directly above the blade where it transitions into the handle, ensuring it acts as a protective barrier for the user's hand. This component not only provides structural support by reinforcing the connection between the blade and handle but also enhances safety by preventing accidental slips during use.

3.description: Then, attach the handle beneath the guard, positioning it securely to ensure a comfortable grip for the user. This addition not only enhances the overall usability of the object by providing a stable hold but also reinforces the structural integrity between the guard and blade, completing the main body of the design.

4.description: Finally, add the butt at the end of the handle to provide a finished appearance and enhance the overall balance of the knife. This component not only completes the aesthetic design but also reinforces the structural integrity by securing the handle and preventing the user's hand from slipping off during use.
